author: jih2nn
content:
I've opened a PR to Prysm that makes it interop with Geth. With a version of Geth that doesn't check payload version, now Prysm and Lodestar are on the same page. (They both complain BALs are not returned, which would be addressed soon.)

Here is the PR: https://github.com/OffchainLabs/prysm/pull/15747

author: jih2nn
content:
For testing purpose, I've created an ad-hoc version of Geth that returns empty BALs and don't use BALs during block processing. Here is the code and Docker image: 

- Code: https://github.com/jihoonsong/go-ethereum/commit/c026a8cf877888c4b0633f93f5a2725cbe06667e
- Image: `jihoonsg/geth-eip7928:bals-off`

Running Lodestar with this Geth version, it seems chain makes progress but Dora showed some problem:

```
[dora] time="2025-09-24T21:10:12Z" level=error msg="failed processing head 32 (0xc9816ed66f7c3d0692c84093b7c54ae328cd4ffda9d81efb5d8bd2a18334619d): unhandled block version gloas" client=1-geth-lodestar service=cl-indexer
[dora] time="2025-09-24T21:10:12Z" level=error msg="failed processing block 32 (0xc9816ed66f7c3d0692c84093b7c54ae328cd4ffda9d81efb5d8bd2a18334619d): unhandled block version gloas" client=1-geth-lodestar service=cl-indexer
[dora] time="2025-09-24T21:10:25Z" level=warning msg="error while building db blocks: block body not found: 32" service=cl-indexer
```

To reproduce, please use this config: https://github.com/jihoonsong/local-devnet-bals/blob/main/kurtosis.config.lodestar.yaml  cc <@792404665068158998> <@808969530608451584>

author: jih2nn
content: FYI, Prysm doesn't work well with this Geth version yet. It's related to some Gloas boilerplate issue. This config is good for reproduction: https://github.com/jihoonsong/local-devnet-bals/blob/main/kurtosis.config.prysm.yaml
